newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU SAYS 1,600 TONNES UK BEEF EXPORTED ILLEGALLY.
newsitem.headline: EU SAYS 1,600 TONNES UK BEEF EXPORTED ILLEGALLY.

text.p: The European Commission said on Thursday that 1,600 tonnes of British beef has been illegally exported to the Netherlands, Russia and Egypt.

Seven hundred tonnes had been seized by the Dutch authorities after being exported via Belgium and the remaining 900 tonnes had probably been exported to Russia and Egypt, a Commission spokesman told a news conference.
The spokesman denied press reports that British beef had been fraudulently marketed in France and Spain and could not confirm reports of exports to other third countries such as Bosnia.

The Commission said on Wednesday it was considering legal action against Britain over the exports which were banned in March 1996 to protect consumer health after the British government said it was possible a human form of the fatal mad cow disease, CJD, could be caught from eating infected beef.
EU Food Safety Commissioner Emma Bonino told Italian TV on Wednesday that "British beef was found to have been exported to Belgium, France, Spain and the Netherlands."
The Commission's announcement followed an EU veterinary inspectors' mission last week to Britain, which included visits to sea ports. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
